summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-sixth Avenue, in the City of Seattle, from East Alder Street to a point one hundred (100) feet north of East Marion Street, by constructing therein a sewer, of proper dimensions and material, together with all necessary catch basins, manholes, flush tanks and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewerage and drainage of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 531 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
